@documentation.@description: This is the System schema in which resides all information regarding capabilities, users, organizations, databases and available actions.

@properties.name: The users name.
@properties.key_hash: An optional key hash for authentication.
@properties.capability: A set of capabilities which the user has access to.

@properties.name: The name of the organization.
@properties.child: The set of children of the organization.
@properties.database: The set of databases controlled by the organization.

@documentation.@comment: Roles are named collections of actions which can be provided to a capability.

@properties.name: The name of the role.
@properties.action: The set of actions associated with the role.

@documentation.@comment: A capability is a set of roles combined with a rescource over which those roles hold.

@properties.scope: The resource over which the role holds.
@properties.role: The set of roles the capability has access to.

@documentation.@comment: The exhaustive list of actions which are available to roles.

@properties.label: The label name of the database.
@properties.comment: A comment associated with the database.
@properties.creation_date: The time of creation of the database.
@properties.state: The system transaction state of the database.

@documentation.@comment: The current system transaction state of a database. Only the 'finalized' state is a consistent state, all others indicate that database construction failed.
